physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Resting ECG demonstrated negative T waves in leads V1 through V3. Elevated total creatine kinase level of 2630 U/L, slightly elevated creatine kinase-MB fraction of 80 U/L, elevated troponin T level of 0.09 ng/mL, normal N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide level of 137 pg/mL. Slightly reduced left ventricular (LV) systolic function (ejection fraction 52%) with regional hypokinesia in the inferolateral wall.

Resting ECG demonstrated diffuse ST-T changes in leads I through III, aVF and V4â€“V6. Elevated total creatine kinase level of 220 U/L. Echocardiography suggested mildly reduced left ventricular systolic function with a hypokinetic inferolateral wall. CMR cine images confirmed severe hypokinesia in the inferolateral wall (left ventricular ejection fraction of 45%).
